name: Easy Salmon Brown Rice Pasta Salad
author: Nichele
summary: This is a unique twist using brown rice pasta instead of ordinary wheat. This brightly colored tasty salad has wild Alaskan salmon, cherry tomatoes, avocado, fresh spinach, and a variety of other veggies. It is so easy to make. Chill in fridge and then serve!!!
ingredients: 1 (14.75 ounce) can salmon, drained and flaked
1 (8 ounce) bottle Italian-style salad dressing (such as Annie's Lemon and Chive Dressing®)
directions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil
Stir in pasta, and return to a boil
Cook pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until it has cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, 10 to 12 minutes
Drop frozen peas and spinach into boiling pasta during the last minute of cooking
Drain pasta, peas, and spinach in a colander
Return pasta, peas, and spinach to the pot
Stir in salmon and salad dressing until well combined
Chill in the refrigerator, about 20 minutes
Gently stir in carrots, tomatoes, cilantro, avocado, and lemon juice
